result.execSummary:
The defendant Antwan R Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
CORRECTED 06-24-2015:  Defendant plead to charge with enhancers and therefore Ct. 1 is a Felony I conviction.  
Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4.5 years bifurcated sentence.
Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant is to participate in and successfully complete Drug Treatment Court.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

timeConds.notes:
**AMENDED 5-28-2015:  Defendant is to report to RCJ on 5/29/15 at 5:00 p.m. until 5/31/15 at 5:00 p.m.**
Stayed.

Defendant Antwan R Clark in court with attorney Nhu H Tran.  Defendant Antwan R Clark in custody.  Jennifer C Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
